title: Data Governance Analyst
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The Data Governance Analyst supports ongoing critical data identification and definition activities. The incumbent will be responsible for two critical functions: 1) use independent judgement to identify, anticipate and oversee identification of data that is critical to strategic business objectives and 2) execution of data policy and standard requirements for identified critical data elements in partnership with lines of business and functional groups. The ideal candidate will bring a variety of skills, be proactive in solving problems, be able to work independently and part of a team, and be comfortable communicating with many different levels of employees across the organization.<p><br></p><strong>Business Unit Description</strong><p><br></p>The US Data Management Office is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC US Region, further enhancing data governance, building out our data and analytic capabilities, and developing the US Region data management strategy.<p><br></p>Our strategy: Leverage data and analytics to build competitive advantage to enhance our client focus. To facilitate this, we will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Improve our data quality through focused data governance programs and processes</li><li>Use new data technology to increase agility and reduce cost</li><li>Become an analytics leader, focusing on continuous advancement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyze reporting outputs to trace metrics back to underlying data components and sources to facilitate critical data identification and classification discussions with business Subject Matter Experts</li><li>Coordinate with stakeholders across the business and technology to define critical data including business, technical and operational metadata attributes</li><li>Monitoring, measuring and taking action to address data quality within the US Data Catalog by incorporating and understanding information from a variety of sources to recommend a course of action</li><li>Escalating, managing and reporting critical data identification and definition issues with transparency, as well as effectively creating accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards</li><li>Be informed and engaged as a subject matter expert on data-related regulatory requirements, organizational policies and standards, as well as industry best practices</li><li>Provide appropriate guidance, education, training, and communication to all relevant stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 years of related work experience in Data Governance</li><li>Broad and comprehensive knowledge and understanding of banking operations and data governance concepts (DCAM preferred) </li><li>Disciplined self-starter with strong analytical, logical, reasoning and problem-solving skills</li><li>Ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with attention to detail and accuracy</li><li>Confidence to work directly with all levels of management and facilitate meetings</li><li>Excellent communication skills - both verbally and written</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) and SharePoint</li><li>Ability to work flexibly in a team environment</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-70 W Madison St, 8th Fl<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Data Analysis, Data Governance, Data Management, Facilitation, Microsoft Power BI, Prioritization, Problem Solving, Project Management, Working Independently

title: Sr Analyst, Consumer & Digital Analytics
description: <em>At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us.</em><p><br></p><em>The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees’ personal and professional lives.</em><p><br></p><strong>Position Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Senior Analyst, Consumer &amp; Digital Analytics develops and delivers business insights for Consumer Media/Digital Marketing function, with a strong focus on translating and enhancing the utilization of data and analytics. This position will be instrumental in the development and ongoing tracking of KPIs and business metrics and by leveraging internal and external data sources and utilizing the most relevant visualization and reporting tools.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Help build analytics solutions and KPIs that achieve impact at scale; focus on answering the most critical questions to help inform the Consumer Media marketing strategy and drive operational efficiency</li><li>Integration and interpretation of multiple sources of Digital and Health data to assess campaign effectiveness, derive insights and actionable recommendations to inform business strategy decisions.</li><li>Support initiatives to segment and track consumer and physician behavior focused on driving optimal promotional spend</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and leverage data from diverse sources, ensure data consistency and reliability. Bring in an enhanced understanding of available data, analyses, and performance levers</li><li>Manage execution and distribution of reports/dashboards</li><li>Develop and foster relationships with internal/external partners to manage work-streams and cross-function deliverables</li><li>Develop, extend, and improve analytics processes to ensure consistent delivery of actionable data and insights to stakeholders and decision makers</li><li>Support ad hoc projects and tasks as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA/BS required</li><li>2-4 years of experience in Consumer Digital Analytics and/or Marketing Analytics</li><li>Experience analyzing websites traffic data using Google Analytics, knowledge of Digital Marketing strategies like Paid Search, Social Media</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in data management and data platforms (such as Microsoft SQL Server), statistical modeling packages (such as Python, SAS, and/or, R) and office productivity software (Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel)</li><li>Familiarity with cloud-based database tools like Google BigQuery</li><li>Demonstrated success developing and presenting solutions to complex business situations, supported by sound and thorough analytics</li><li>Highly proficient analytical and software skills aimed at data analysis</li><li>Familiarity with pharmaceutical data including Rx, physician and claims data preferred</li><li>High degree of independence and exceptional work ethic</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Professional, proactive demeanor</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Values</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference.</li><li>Accountability: We do what’s right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures.</li><li>Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one’s team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective</li><li>Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources</li><li>Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments</li><li>Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working</li><li>Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better.</em><p><br></p><em>Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.</em>

Responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in the evaluation and definition of the User Experience, specifying standards for how applications and desktops should perform, anticipating user interaction with upgrades and patch management, optimizing user interfaces, and ensuring intuitive, elegant system design and optimal supportability.</li><li>Defining procedures for imaging and Risk teams to define and evolve new ways of delivering applications to any device.</li><li>Defining and implementing standard policies, procedures, and processes for endpoint device management, including operating system and application deployment, application packaging and configuration, and the securing of the environment against the installation or execution of unapproved applications.</li><li>Assisting in the vulnerability management efforts of the firm following the standards set by the firm's Information Risk Management team, including the deployment of security patches using an enterprise patch management solution and the configuration of security controls such as AppLocker application whitelisting, NTFS permissions, and Windows Firewall rules.</li><li>Demonstrating expert-level proficiency with key technologies to be supported, including willingness and ability to develop expertise in new technologies as needed.</li><li>Driving innovation and continuous improvement of the end user computing environment. </li><li>Evaluating the impact of relevant emerging technology and business trends.</li><li>Providing technical and operational governance across the firm's end-user computing environment.</li><li>Offering excellent third-tier knowledge and support to first- and second-tier technical support analysts during issue
